Lynn.Swampscott Town Hall: Swampscott Town Hall, previously the Elihu Thomson House, is a historic building at 22 Monument Avenue, Swampscott, Massachusetts. The house was designed by architect James Kelley and built in 1889 for the noted inventor, electrical engineer, and industrialist Elihu Thomson (1853-1937) who was, with Thomas Edison, co-founder of General Electric Company. The house was built with an observatory, which no longer exists.
